Based on the patient’s Stage III (3A) rectal adenocarcinoma with node-positive disease, microsatellite-stable status (MSS), and the known high risk of recurrence—particularly within the first two years—even after standard adjuvant FOLFOX chemotherapy, this patient remains at substantial risk for relapse over the next 24 months. Clinical surveillance (CEA trend, imaging) so far shows no recurrence, but epidemiologically, the 2-year recurrence rate in Stage III MSS colorectal cancer is on the order of 30–40%. Therefore, recurrence within the next 24 months remains likely.  

[ANSWER: A) Yes]
